required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Stent Implantation for Patients With SIDSMA
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Observational Cohort Study in Patients With SIDSMA Treated With Stents

lead_sponsor.agency: First Affiliated Hospital of Zhejiang University

clinical_study.source: First Affiliated Hospital of Zhejiang University

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to evaluate the prognosis in patients with spontaneous isolated dissection of the superior mesenteric artery (SIDSMA) who have been treated with stents.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is a prospective, observational study. Patients who have been diagnosed as spontaneous isolated dissection of the superior mesenteric artery (SIDSMA) and treated with stents are enrolled in the study. We will evaluate the patency of stent, remodeling of the dissection and the relief of the symptoms in the next 2 years after patients have received stents.

primary_outcome.measure: Patency of stents deployed in the superior mesenteric artery
primary_outcome.description: The patency of stents deployed in the superior mesenteric artery shall be evaluated via computed tomographic angiography

primary_outcome.measure: Remodeling of the superior mesenteric artery
primary_outcome.description: Complete remodeling was defined as the absence of residual arterial dissection and stenosis via follow-up computed tomographic angiography. Incomplete remodeling was defined as improved luminal patency of the superior mesenteric artery but worse than complete remodeling.

secondary_outcome.description: Most of patients with SIDSMA are symptomatic. The symptoms mainly include abdominal pain, hematochezia, nausea and vomiting.After the procedure, the time delay between the stent implantation and disappearance of these symptoms are documented.
New dissection or aneurysm formation in the superior mesenteric artery

clinical_study.condition: Dissection of the Superior Mesenteric Artery

study_pop.textblock: Patients who have been diagnosed as spontaneous isolated dissection of the superior mesenteric artery (SIDSMA) and treated with stents are potential candidates for the study. All participants must meet all inclusion criteria and none of the exclusion criteria.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Male or non-pregnant female over 18 years of age
2. Diagnosed as spontaneous isolated dissection of the superior mesenteric artery
3. Patients have been successfully treated with stents
4. Patients are willing to participate in this study
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Life expectancy of < 5 years;
2. Other surgeries or endovascular treatments have been taken concurrently.
3. Elevated serum level

facility.name: the First Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

clinical_study.keyword: dissection of the superior mesenteric artery
